required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Morpho-functional Changes After Oral Supplementation of Antioxidants and Anti-inflammatory Treatment in Age-Related Macular Degeneration.
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Macular Function and Related Changes in Visual Perception and Retinal Morphology After 6 Months of Use of Oral Supplementation Called MACUPREV, in Patients With Dry Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD)

brief_summary.textblock:
In patients with AMD a deterioration of the antioxidant mechanisms of the retina is observed and therefore an increase in the production of free radicals responsible for tissue damage.
The Age-Related Eye Disease Study (AREDS) found that the intake of antioxidants reduces the risk of progression of the disease to an advanced stage (choroidal neovascularization or geographic atrophy ) and reduces the loss of visual acuity.
In this study the investigators want to analyze the functional retinal changes (mfERG) of the macular region, in patients with dry age-related macular degeneration, after the use for 6 months of an oral supplementation based on Ganoderma lucidum (Reishi), Calendula Officinalis, Lutepure-Marigold ( 5% Lutein and 1% Zeaxanthin) Blueberry, Rutin, Alpha-lipoic acid, Bromelain, NAC, Vtiamine C, B9, B12, D3, Selenium, Zinc and Copper.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: monocentric, prospective, double blind randomized six months study

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Multifocal electroretinogram (mfERG) in patients with dry age-related macular degeneration after 6 months follow up
primary_outcome.time_frame: Functional retinal changes after 6 months follow up
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate functional retinal changes of the macular region by multifocal electroretinogram in patients with dry age-related macular degeneration after the use for 6 months of an oral supplementation in tablets based on Ganoderma lucidum (Reishi), Calendula Officinalis, Lutepure-Marigold ( 5% Lutein and 1% Zeaxanthin) Blueberry, Rutin, Alpha-lipoic acid, Bromelain, NAC, Vtiamine C, B9, B12, D3, Selenium, Zinc and Copper. The researchers analyzed the average response amplitude densities (RAD: nanoV/ degree 2) between the first negative peak, N1 and the first positive peak, P1

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate correlation between mfERG changes (functional activity) and morphological retinal changes (CRT: central retinal thickness and VD: vessel density at the superficial and deep capillary plexa) after 6 months follow up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Morpho-functional retinal relationships after 6 months follow up
secondary_outcome.description: The researchers evaluated the linear relationships between the mfERG (Response Amplitude Density (RAD nanoV/degree2) and OCT/OCTA values (CRT in micron and vessel density in mm3) by Pearson's Test after administration of a oral supplementation (Macuprev)

arm_group.description: patients taking oral supplementation (Macuprev) 2 capsules per day for 6 months
patients taking oral placebo 2 capsules per day for 6 months

intervention.description: oral supplementation (Macuprev) 2 capsules per day for 6 months
oral placebo 2 capsules per day for 6 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age> 50;
- dry AMD not in therapy with oral supplements or antioxidants
- visual acuity ≥ 20/40
- ability to provide written informed consent and to follow the procedures of the study;
Exclusion Criteria:
- spherical refractive error greater than ±6 diopters
- cylindrical refractive error greater than ±3 dioptres
- opacity of diopter means
- any active or past retinal pathology other than AMD
- history of ocular surgery (<6 months)
- Pregnancy

reference.citation: Age-Related Eye Disease Study Research Group, SanGiovanni JP, Chew EY, Clemons TE, Ferris FL 3rd, Gensler G, Lindblad AS, Milton RC, Seddon JM, Sperduto RD.
